title: Planning a Team Project
description: Listen to colleagues discussing their plans for an upcoming project.

audio.text:
Manager: Alright everyone, let's discuss the marketing project. We need to have everything ready by the end of the month. Lisa, what are you going to work on?
Lisa: I'm going to focus on the social media campaign. I've already started brainstorming ideas, and I'm meeting with the design team tomorrow to discuss visuals.
Manager: Great. How long do you think it will take?
Lisa: I estimate it will take about two weeks to complete the initial plan. After that, I'll need another week to finalize everything.
Manager: Perfect. Tom, what about you?
Tom: I'm going to handle the market research. I'll be sending out surveys next week, and I'm expecting results within ten days.
Manager: Will you have the analysis ready by the fifteenth?
Tom: I think so, but there's a possibility we might need a few extra days if we get a lot of responses.
Manager: That's fine. Just keep me updated. Sarah, you're working on the budget, right?
Sarah: Yes, I'm going to prepare the budget proposal. I'll probably finish the first draft by Friday. Then I'm going to review it with the finance team next Monday.
Manager: Excellent. Now, are there any potential problems we should anticipate?
Lisa: Well, the design team is quite busy this month. There's a chance they won't be able to deliver on time.
Manager: I'll talk to them about priorities. Anything else?
Tom: The survey platform might be down for maintenance next Wednesday. If that happens, I'll postpone the launch until Thursday.
Manager: Good thinking. Let's schedule a follow-up meeting for next Friday at 2 PM. Does that work for everyone?
All: Yes, that works.
Manager: Great. I'll send calendar invites this afternoon. Thanks, everyone!
